head.title: No-Cost Help for Those Involved in a Divorce

hedline.hl1: No-Cost Help for Those Involved in a Divorce

abstract.p: Micki McWade letter on disputes depressing portrayal of 12-Step Divorce Recovery Group in September 10 article on suburban divorces (S)

block.p: Although I was grateful that you gave coverage to the 12-Step Divorce Recovery Group [''Dissolving a Suburban Marriage,'' Sept. 10], I was disappointed that the article represented our meeting and our speaker from such a depressing perspective. Our speaker shared a true story that did indeed start almost tragically but ended with spiritual growth achieved, emotional strength gained and with recovery. Is recovery not newsworthy?

Although I was grateful that you gave coverage to the 12-Step Divorce Recovery Group [''Dissolving a Suburban Marriage,'' Sept. 10], I was disappointed that the article represented our meeting and our speaker from such a depressing perspective. Our speaker shared a true story that did indeed start almost tragically but ended with spiritual growth achieved, emotional strength gained and with recovery. Is recovery not newsworthy?
It is important that people are made aware of no-cost resources in Westchester County during such a traumatic time, but the article provided no such information.

Twelve-Step Divorce Recovery Groups meet in Mount Kisco, Shrub Oak and White Plains. Attendance is $1 per meeting. The goal is for people to gain strength and hope through the experiences of others and to create support in the new, single environment. Contact (914) 424-4522.

The Coalition for Family Justice, run by Monica Getz, meets once a month in Irvington. The goal is to allow people access to volunteer attorneys, judges and other experts, free of charge. Contact (914) 591-7020.
